articles.title: Argentina food chamber knocks back government prize freeze plan
articles.description: COPAL said the food and beverage industry was "willing to reach an agreement on price freezes" but called for "genuine dialogue instead of unilateral decisions." "We continue to hope that an agreement can be reached," said presidential spokeswoman Gabriela Cerruti, adding the government was looking at proposals and modifications.
articles.content:
Argentina's umbrella food industry chamber said on Tuesday that a government proposal to freeze prices on some 1,650 food and household goods fell short of an offer the sector could accept and criticized officials for pushing a one-sided deal.

articles.title: Argentina food chamber knocks back government prize freeze plan
articles.description:
Argentina's umbrella food industry chamber said on Tuesday that a government proposal to freeze prices on some 1,650 food and household goods fell short of an offer the sector could accept and criticized officials for pushing a one-sided deal.
COPAL, however, said in a statement that the call from the government for price freezes did not give the food and beverage sector enough guarantees.

articles.description: Jonathan Rea lost further ground in the World Superbike title race after Toprak Razgatlioglu produced an imperious ride to win yesterday’s first race at the penultimate round in Argentina.

articles.title: Jonathan Rea falls further behind in World Superbike title race as Toprak Razgatlioglu wins first race in Argentina
articles.description: Jonathan Rea is now 29 points behind rival Toprak Razgatlioglu in the World Superbike title race after the Turkish rider won the first feature race of the weekend in Argentina.
articles.content:

articles.title: Argentina touts economic 'roadmap', investors remain wary
articles.description: Argentine senior officials met with private investors in New York on Friday, touting a much sought-after economic "roadmap" for the embattled country and playing up the chances of a positive deal with the International Monetary Fund.
